heisig_constituent: tin can, noon, sign of the horse, shovel
heisig_story: Though the meaning has no reference to animals, the parts do: horse with a mountain underneath.
koohiiStory1: Horses kept in the mountains have a unique savory taste. At least so the text on this tin can would have us believe, which contains 100% authentic mountain horse.
koohiiStory2: The starving horse, stranded on the mountain, is forced to eat a tasty tin can.

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The radical can is the same as the kanji can. Usually when we talk about a can with this kanji we mean a tin can, though.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture a tin can in your mind as clearly as you can.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic:
The reading for a can is „Åã„Çì, which seems impossibly easy. If that isn't close enough for you, picture this:
Genghis Khan („Åã„Çì) is drinking out of a tin can. He glug glug glugs, gasps, and wipes his face. He holds out the can, "Khan made cans," and winks.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: „Åã„Çì is can, it's really easy, come on. Just take this one.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: (looks like) a can with a can opener
humanum_full_description_en:
The shape of a golden inscription like a vessel, the upper like a lid, the original meaning is Áº∂. "Said Wen": "Fu, pottery is the reason why wine is served. The Qin people use drums for festivals. Pictograms. All the belongings of the fou follow the fou."

It is said that " Fu " is a simple province of "Âåã" (inscriptions in inscriptions and meanings). It is like holding a pestle to make pottery.

" Fou " is a container used to hold water or wine, popular in the Spring and Autumn Period. Oracle is used as the name of the country and people. Bronze writing is used as the original meaning. Cai Hou Zhu Fou: "Cai Hou Zhu Zhi Fou." "Er Ya. Release device ":" Ang that of Fou "and as a person's name, Xiao Chen Fou Ding:" Wang Yi (gift) Xiao Chen Yu Fou responsibility (product) five years "," Xiao Chen "is the Official name," Fou "is the name," Yu "is a place name," responsibility "is read" product "refers to the tribute, such as salary Chu Wo meters and the like (see Li Xueqin). It means that the king bestowed five years' worth of rice from the land. The "Xiaochen Fou" in the Shang Bronze Inscriptions is also seen in the oracle bone inscriptions. It is also known as " treasure ", and Jingjiang Ku: "It is used for eternity."

The word "Áº∂" in the sound of " afternoon " is the same as the word " bao " in inscriptions, see " bao ".
humanum_short_description_en: The shape of a golden inscription like a vessel, with a lid on it, with the original meaning of fou.

pottery
Basic explanation of words
pottery
f«íu
An ancient pottery for wine with a big belly and a small mouth.
pottery
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]Ôºªf«íuÔºΩ
["Guangyun" Fang Jiu cut, there is no. ]
Also known as "Áºª1".
(1) Pottery for wine syrup. There are also copper manufacturers.
(2) Pottery for drawing or holding water.
(3) Tile basin.
(4) Tile-quality percussion instruments.
(5) The name of the ancient measuring instrument. One Fou is sixteen buckets.
(6) The name of the ancient measuring instrument. One Fou is thirty-two buckets.

Name meaning
The original meaning refers to a kind of ancient wine pottery, and also refers to a kind of ceramic musical instrument.

Radicals: Áº∂  (can)
Meaning Mnemonic
The radical can is the same as the kanji can. Usually when we talk about a can with this kanji we mean a tin can, though.
Picture a tin can in your mind as clearly as you can.
Reading Mnemonic
The reading for a can is „Åã„Çì, which seems impossibly easy. If that isn't close enough for you, picture this:
Genghis Khan („Åã„Çì) is drinking out of a tin can. He glug glug glugs, gasps, and wipes his face. He holds out the can, "Khan made cans," and winks.
„Åã„Çì is can, it's really easy, come on. Just take this one.
